com.hazelcast.internal.networking.nio

Class NioNetworking

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.networking.nio.NioNetworking
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Networking

    public final class NioNetworking
extends Object
implements Networking
    A non blocking Networking implementation that makes use of Selector to have a limited set of io threads, handle an arbitrary number of connections. Each NioChannel has 2 parts:
    1. NioInboundPipeline: triggered by the NioThread when data is available in the socket. The NioInboundPipeline takes care of reading data from the socket and calling the appropriate InboundHandler
    2. NioOutboundPipeline: triggered by the NioThread when either space is available in the socket for writing, or when there is something that needs to be written e.g. a Packet. The NioOutboundPipeline takes care of calling the appropriate OutboundHandler to convert the OutboundFrame to bytes in in the ByteBuffer and writing it to the socket.
    By default the NioThread blocks on the Selector, but it can be put in a 'selectNow' mode that makes it spinning on the selector. This is an experimental feature and will cause the io threads to run hot. For this reason, when this feature is enabled, the number of io threads should be reduced (preferably 1).

      • register

        public Channel register(SocketChannel socketChannel,
                        boolean clientMode)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Networking
        Registers the SocketChannel to the EventLoop group and returns the created Channel. The Channel is not yet started so that modifications can be made to the channel e.g. adding attributes. Once this is done the Channel.start() needs to be called. In the future we need to think about passing the socket channel because it binds Networking to tcp and this is not desirable.
        Specified by:
        register in interface Networking
        Parameters:
        socketChannel - the socketChannel to register
        clientMode - if the channel is made in clientMode or server mode
        Returns:
        the created Channel
        Throws:
        IOException - when something failed while registering the socketChannel
